definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able

sentences.english: Learned before, a table personnel, optimistic, cheerful, witty humor.
sentences.chinese: 博学多才，一表人才，开朗乐观，风趣幽默。

sentences.english: That didn't stop Chinese pundits from making a fuss over it.
sentences.chinese: 这并没有阻止中国的博学之士对此大惊小怪。

sentences.english: Investigation proved him to be a man of deep and broad erudition.
sentences.chinese: 调查证明他是一位深且广的博学。

sentences.english: He is very knowledgable and quite strict with us.
sentences.chinese: 他非常博学，而且对我们很严格。

sentences.english: He who does God's will and renounces his own is truly very learned.
sentences.chinese: 真正博学的人尊行上帝的旨意，丢弃自己的意思。

sentences.english: To create a mythology, you have to be an open book.
sentences.chinese: 要创造神话，你必须成为一个博学多闻的人。

sentences.english: She's really clued up on politics.
sentences.chinese: 她对政治非常博学多闻。

sentences.english: And in public appearances he does not even try to disguise his erudition.
sentences.chinese: 在公开露面的场合，他也不刻意隐瞒他的博学多闻。

sentences.english: He is a man of wide information.
Our professor is Very abundance scholarly.
sentences.chinese: 咱们的教授非比寻常博学多闻。

sentences.english: Such erudition is greatly praised and honoured.
sentences.chinese: 这种博学是极受赞赏和尊重的。

sentences.english: They fancied themselves learned and assumed airs of erudition.
sentences.chinese: 他们自以为有学问，摆出一副博学的样子。

sentences.english: His erudition comes from his assiduous study.
sentences.chinese: 他的博学来自他的刻苦钻研。

sentences.english: There was once a wise old woman who lived back in the hills.
sentences.chinese: 从前，有一位博学的老妇人，她住在后山。

sentences.english: And the third thing was that Michael was extremely well-read.
sentences.chinese: 第三件事是迈克尔是个相当博学的人。

definition: erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
have wide learning and a retentive memory/have encyclopedic knowledge
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
